Title: AN ACT APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF THIRTY-TWO THOUSAND PESOS, PHILIPPINE CURRENCY, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A ROAD ACROSS THE PROVINCE OF SAMAR, CONNECTING THE MUNICIPALITIES OF WRIGHT AND TAFT, IN SAID PROVINCE.
Data:
[ Act No. 1307, March 03, 1905 ]
AN ACT APPROPRIATING THE SUM OF THIRTY-TWO THOUSAND PESOS, PHILIPPINE CURRENCY, FOR THE CONSTRUCTION OF A ROAD ACROSS THE PROVINCE OF SAMAR, CONNECTING THE MUNICIPALITIES OF WRIGHT AND TAFT, IN SAID PROVINCE.
By authority of the United States, be it enacted by the Philippine Commission, that:
Section 1. There is hereby appropriated, out of the funds to he realized by the issue of improvement bonds authorized by Act Numbered Thirteen hundred and one, the sum of thirty-two thousand pesos. Philippine currency, for the purpose of constructing a road and its necessary bridges connecting the municipalities of Wright and Taft, in the Province of Samar. The construction of said road shall be commenced at the municipality of Wright and shall be continued toward that of Taft, as far as the sum herein appropriated permits.
Section 2. The provisions and conditions provided in sections two to six, inclusive, of Act Numbered Nine hundred and twenty are hereby made applicable to the appropriation made in section one of this Act.
Section 3.1a—àphi1 The public good requiring the speedy enactment of this bill, the passage of the same is hereby expedited in accordance with section two of "An Act prescribing the order of procedure by the Commission in the enactment of laws," passed September twenty-sixth, nineteen hundred.
Section 4. This Act shall take effect on its passage.
Enacted, March 3, 1905.
